oai_dc:dc.dc:title: REFLECTION FROM SWASH ZONE ON NATURAL BEACHES
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Kubota, Susumu
Mizuguchi, Masaru
Takezawa, Mitsuo
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: reflection
swash zone
natural beach
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: For separating incident and reflected waves, three methods based on linear long-wave theory, smal1-amplitude wave theory, and quasi-non 1inear long-wave theory were applied to field data recorded on a steeply sloping beach and on a gently sloping beach. The method based on the quasi-non 1inear long-wave theory gave the best results and described well the observed, incident, and reflected wave field.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 22 (1990): Proceedings of 22nd Conference on Coastal Engineering, Delft, The Netherlands, 1990.
